title: World Cup: Messi scores as Argentina defeats Mexico 2-0
description: Lionel Messi helped keep Argentina's World Cup bid alive with the first goal in a 2-0 victory over Mexico on Saturday. Messi tied icon Diego Maradona on eight goals and 21 appearances at the World Cup for Argentina.

title: Meet the Jewish Antwerp diamond dealer who collects anti-Semitic cartoons
description: Since 1962, this son of an Auschwitz survivor has been collecting drawings, books, posters, newspapers, paintings and objects, a selection of which can currently be seen in the Brussels offices of the European Commission.

title: Europe is struggling to find a response to US anti-inflation plan
description: Faced with massive subsidies for green "made in America" products starting in January, European leaders fear that companies will favor the United States for their investments and production.

title: 'Do we have to lose European citizenship to understand the price? Ask Britons who regret Brexit'
description: Many Britons have experienced Brexit as an amputation after leaving the EU took away their European citizenship. Now, those who can are applying for German or Irish passports.

title: Varane back for France in Denmark World Cup clash
description: The center-back returns for France's match against Denmark at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

title: Xinjiang loosens some restrictions after anti-lockdown protests
description: Residents had been holding demonstrations against the city's draconian zero-Covid lockdown.

title: 'She Said': A return to the roots of #MeToo
description: Maria Schrader's film chronicles the 'New York Times' investigation that broke the Harvey Weinstein case in 2017.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Changing how stoppage time is calculated risks breaking up the game'
description: FIFA has introduced new rules to establish the duration of stoppages in play, but the inflation of this play time could risk the uniqueness of the sport, according to sports journalist Jérôme Latta.

title: 'Fame' and 'Flashdance' singer and actress Irene Cara dies aged 63
description: The Oscar-winning singer passed away at her home in Florida on Friday, according to her publicist.

title: Taiwan leader Tsai resigns as ruling party chief after local elections loss
description: Voters in Taiwan overwhelmingly chose the opposition Nationalist party in several major races across the self-ruled island.

title: Bono 'surrenders' on intimate book tour at Paris' Grand Rex
description: The U2 frontman was open-hearted at the Grand Rex in Paris on Friday, on the European leg of his 'Stories of Surrender' tour.

title: French investigative site Mediapart goes to court to denounce censorship, defend press freedom
description: The site had been forced to halt publishing a new article on a French mayor, Gaël Perdriau, on the grounds that it would constitute an invasion of his privacy.

title: Landslide leaves up to a dozen missing on the Italian island Ischia
description: Deaths are feared after homes were swept away by a landslide triggered by heavy rain on the island of Ischia, near Naples.

title: London Fire Brigade only latest British institution to be found 'racist' and misogynist
description: The report, which comes only one month after the UK's justice system was found to be 'racist,' found women, those from an ethnic minority, and LGBTQ+ people were more likely to experience 'poor treatment.'

title: Australia beats Tunisia 1-0 to revive its World Cup campaign
description: Australia won a World Cup game for only the third time in their history with a dogged 1-0 victory over Tunisia.

title: A wall of distrust separates the English from their politicians
description: 'The English malaise' (6/6): In this series, 'Le Monde' examines the deepening crisis that England is enduring, marked by political instability and a deteriorating social climate.

title: McKinsey affair becomes focus of Macron's trip marking awareness of violence against women
description: Under a heavy atmosphere, the French president spoke about measures to help victims of domestic violence in France on the International Day of the Elimination of Violence against Women.

title: 'I wasn't elected for this': French mayors in firing line as violence and death threats on the rise
description: The number of French elected officials who are victims of attacks is constantly increasing.

title: FIFA is turning a blind eye to Qatar controversies
description: One might have expected the Italian-Swiss Gianni Infantino, head of the football association since 2016, to invite Qatar to commit to initiatives to be more progressive. Instead, the opposite has happened.

title: World Cup 2022: The elusive art of Didier Deschamps' public speaking
description: Between political cant and humor, the boss of  'Les Bleus', who are playing their second World Cup game on Saturday, answers questions with a consummate art of evasion.

title: English design maestro William Morris celebrated in French exhibition
description: This British figure was an acclaimed creator of wallpaper for Victorian houses, a designer of furniture, books and stained glass, a socialist activist and a writer.

title: 'Relational urbanism,' or how to reconcile the need for space with the need for social contact
description: Incorporating mental health into city planning is becoming a necessity. Including more green spaces and making public spaces more vibrant will help to create a "functional city" that combats loneliness and helps to forge social bonds.

title: Africa's moment of reckoning with France
description: The former colonial power is increasingly contested in the streets of the continent – a situation that benefits the interests of Russia.

title: 'The war in Ukraine is a steamroller that crushes other crisis situations like those in Ethiopia or Haiti.'
description: The Ethiopian conflict and the Haitian crisis are reduced to limited visibility, according to Jean-Philippe Rémy, head of 'Le Monde' international section, in his column.

title: Giorgia Meloni's exaggerations about France's 'colonial currency'
description: In a video from 2019 that recently resurfaced on Twitter, the Italian Prime Minister accused France of using the CFA franc to 'exploit the resources' of African countries.

title: The Russian anti-war artists who have found exile in Paris
description: Forced into exile after Russia's invasion of Ukraine, producers, directors and artists are organizing the first delocalized version of a Moscow festival in central Paris at the Récollets residential center.

title: Three killed in double school shooting in Brazil
description: A 16-year-old opened fire on Friday in two schools in the city of Aracruz. President-elect Lula called the shootings an 'absurd tragedy.'

title: Vladimir Putin's highly supervised meeting with mothers of soldiers
description: The Russian leader met with a select group of women, who refrained from giving any criticism. He hoped to ease the growing dissatisfaction of some wives and mothers.

title: Taiwan's long-standing party tries to stay relevant
description: The Kuomintang party is attempting to reinvent itself in the local elections on November 26, without changing its position in relation to China.

title: London Fire Brigade taking 'immediate action' after a report concluded it was misogynistic and racist
description: An independent review, launched in March last year, was conducted following the death by suicide of a trainee firefighter.

title: Honduras declares state of emergency against gang crime
description: It is the second country in Central America, after El Salvador, to do so to fight crimes like extortion. The measure must still be approved by Congress.
